basics.name: Alberta Longhini
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate
basics.summary: A Ph.D. candidate focusing on adaptive manipulation of Cloth-like Deformable Objects (CDO) at the Division of Robotics, Perception, and Learning (RPL), KTH Royal Institute of Technology, with a research interest in combining robotics and machine learning for better perception and manipulation in unstructured environments.

work.name: KTH Royal Institute of Technology
work.summary: Working on adaptive manipulation of deformable objects using robotics and machine learning.
highlights: Supervisors: Danica Kragic, Michael C. Welle, Jens Lundell

work.name: Carnegie Mellon University
work.summary: Collaborated with researchers in deformable object manipulation.

work.name: KTH Royal Institute of Technology
work.summary: Assisted in teaching Introduction to Robotics and Image Analysis courses.

publications.name: Textile taxonomy and classification using pulling and twisting
publications.publisher: 2021 IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS)

publications.name: EDO-Net: Learning Elastic Properties of Deformable Objects from Graph Dynamics
publications.publisher: 2023 IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)

publications.name: AdaFold: Adapting Folding Trajectories of Cloths via Feedback-loop Manipulation

awards.title: Mille e una lode Award
awards.summary: Awarded a selective scholarship by the University of Padova to excellent students.

references.name: Danica Kragic
references.reference: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden

references.reference: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden
